column4: i've just had a horrendous time trying to get my new and shiny Ubuntu 11.10 to connect on a static ip setup using NetworkManager
any advice on making this simple?
What is your connection type?
Is it PPTP, or something else?
sorry - you've already gone past my skillset
Like, do you have a router that dispenses the internet for you, or do you just have a cable that goes to your computer?
Okay, so what do you want to make simple? Entering parameters?
Like, user name and password?
Sorry, I have never done it via command line.
But what precisely do you mean under «everything I have«?
ip address, subnet, gateway
Ok.
It is fairly easy to do via Network Manager.
Just click on the applet, see the «Wired» tab.
I meant, click the applet, go for the «Edit Connections» line.
Then «Wired».
I have not encountered that issue. Does simply pressing the «Add» button and entering the details under the IPv4 tab work?
it stores it as a connection, but when you click on Connection Information it pops up with "Error displaying connection information:
That is not nice. I have not encountered that issue personally, but you might want to look for solutions here. http://askubuntu.com/search?q=wired+network+device+not+managed
